posts.author: hunearo
posts.content:
Hi! I didn't play much nwn since my OC ranger, but I'm still here :)

So, here's the idea: lets make a brute who can HiPS and land sneaks. The very first concept was a Fighter/Ass/SD, then I thought why bother with Ass, I could simply just use Rogue. And then I found this: The Faceless by Demos. This is almost the same as my idea, and we dont need a similair build, right?
And then I remembered an older idea, a DEX based sneaker Monk with HiPS and max APR (maybe there is something like that in the legacy builds, and this is why I didn't post it.. but I cannot check them right now, so dunno). Change it to STR based, and lets see what can we do with it.

We will need Monk and SD, obviously, this leaves only the BG as a third class, if we want 10 APR and sneaks.

A very raw build comes here:

Human (11 monk / 28 BG / 1 SD)
Abilities: 16 STR, 15 DEX, 14 CON, 8 WIS, 14 INT, 8 CHA - everything goes to STR

Pre-epic:
10 monk / 10 BG split here
1-8 needs to be monk, after that whatever you want
This way we get 17 pre-epic bab
Feats:
 - must have: ambidexterity, twf, itwf, dodge, mobility
 - the rest: my first thoughts were SkF in hide and MS, and stealthy, but I dont know if we really need these... expertise, blind fight and weapon focus could be a better alternative

Epic:
We only have two dump levels here, and we don't have too much options about them. We need that SD asap to get HiPS, and the last monk level alap (as late as possible... are we using this? :D), the rest is BG.
Feats:
 - great STR IV, ESkF in hide and MS, epic fiendish servant, epic prowess, armor skin... we dont have too much options with the BG epic bonus feats. EWF and maybe improved sneaks?

Skills in general:
247 skill points
Hide-MS max (2x43), tumble 40 would be good, a maxed discipline (43) too. What else? We have access to taunt, but we are ugly AF... anyhow, max it too (42). This leaves us with 36 spare points, those could go into spot maybe.

So how does it look like? For a moment I thought about make it unarmed. Only 8 APR, but better base damage, but we need more monk levels for this (12 for d12, 16 for d20), wich means weaker sneaks and less bonus feats. It also makes the twf feats unnecessary, so we gain some feats pre-epic. We could even get 20 monk and get all the goodies from perfect self.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Take a look at GDL's: The Assassin King: Fighter 14 / Shadowdancer 1 / Assassin 25 (you find it in the old epic build archives) before you say "why bother with strength based assassin?".

If you want a strength based monk/BG/SD build in robes, both Monk8/BG10/SD2 and Monk12/BG8 will secure BAB17, but the AC will suffer with dex 15, wis 8 and only 11 monk levels

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Unless I'm missing something, why Blackguard and not Ranger (particularly as you're not use the CHA stuff)? All I can think of is the sneak attack, and I can't remember whether SD gets that or not. You'd get your D-W feats for "free", which would give you some more scope for others. If you're going STR-based, then sneak - while lovely - is less needed than for a DEX build imho. You also wouldn't have to be a bad dude - although that might be part of what you want anyway.

Oh, just checked SD, and no, it doesn't get sneak attacks (I could argue why it should, but there's little point).

Haven't checked GDL's build, but I do seem to recall reading of a time when several of our Guild members were presenting STR-based assassins (even Max!), and none were what you'd call shabby.

Anyway, just my two-penneth-worth!

Cheers

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: If you want to be sneaky, you need to go with high DEX, or you're handicapping yourself.

posts.author: hunearo
posts.content:
I know it is a bit crazy...:) but maybe not that crazy like my other idea (the unarmed barb) :D

First, I'm sorry, didn't want to hurt anyones feelings when I said "why bother with Ass" :) I'm just not very familiar with that class and I thought a rogue gets everything the build needs and is a bit simpler than the assassin.

True, those splits Mick said still secure BAB 17, but in both version I stuck with less BG levels (less than 28), wich means weaker sneaks and less feats.

Why BG?
 - BG has a pet, although I don't how how tough it is, but it could help with sneaks
 - free once-a-day bulls str
 - a mildly strong undead turning

Drawbacks of BG
 - sadly you get a penalty on your saves with a negative CHA modifier...

Is it really necessary to maximise DEX for a sneaky character? I can boost my dex to 26 (+8) with items, and I have ESkF (+10) wich means 61 in the stealth skills. I suppose a regular spotter usually doesn't bother with ESkF and WIS boosting items, so he's around 43 in detecting hiding enemies.
Anyway I have a pet who can draw the attention of epic spotters.
EDIT:
I just checked the mechanics of stealth and detect modes. Passive detecting is only d10+half skill, so even the ESkF in hide and MS seems to be a little overkill against standard monsters. I don't think they are in active search while they are just wandering around. Or am I missing something?


And lastly, why str based sneaker?
Dunno... it just popped into my mind. Happens all the time. See: unarmed barb :D

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi hunearo, sorry it's been a while getting back to you, but I've been obsessing about other things. But to show you haven't been forgotten...

I've had a look around and found three builds you might be interested in. I admit, none contain Monk, but they're all STR-based sneakers. They can be found in Hip's database. There's Tyr Templar's Dark Prince (The Impaler), which is a BG 25/ Fighter 12/ Rogue 3; Valerfor's The Antipaladin, a BG 28/ Fighter 8/ Rogue 4; and Mick Dagger's Champion of Gruumsh, a BG 28/ Barbarian 10/ Rogue 2.

What do you think?

I checked those BG builds, I like them, but currently I have something else in my mind.

Back to the roots:
I dropped the monk and BG levels, and tried several other combos with SD (like ranger/ass/sd, ranger/rogue/sd), but was not satisfied with the builds. So I'm here again with the original idea of the ftr/rogue/sd. I checked the faceless build again, and realised, that it is not a dual-wield build.
